name: Ginger Beer-Glazed Butternut Squash With Gremolata
description: While most winter squash recipes call for roasting the firm vegetable until nutty and caramelized, this recipe highlights the vegetable’s creamy texture and sweet notes by simmering it in ginger beer until supple. Like many glazed recipes, this one showcases the beauty of great timing: When the squash is done cooking, the liquid will have reduced to a glossy sauce (provided you’ve cut the squash into 1-inch pieces). Topping the mixture with a confetti-like gremolata of chopped ginger, garlic, parsley and orange zest turns this into a cold-weather side that sparkles.
keywords: butternut squash, ginger beer, parsley, christmas, thanksgiving, fall, winter, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup vegetable stock, plus more if needed
1 medium (3-pound) butternut squash, peeled, seeded and cut into 1-inch jewel-shaped chunks
Kosher salt (such as Diamond Crystal) and black pepper
2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley leaves
1/4 teaspoon finely grated fresh orange zest

recipeInstructions.text: Add the ginger beer and stock to a large, deep skillet. Bring to a boil over high.

Add the squash in an even layer. Top with the butter, honey and cloves (if using), and season with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Reduce the heat to medium-high and cook, stirring occasionally, until the squash is tender and the sauce thickens to a glaze, about 25 minutes.
While squash simmers, prepare the gremolata: Chop the parsley, ginger, garlic and orange zest together until thoroughly combined.
Once the squash is tender and the sauce has reduced to a glaze, give it a taste and season with salt and pepper. Transfer the squash to a wide, shallow bowl. Sprinkle with the gremolata and serve.
